perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Bank will use their best efforts to cause any post-effective amendment to the Registration Statement to be declared effective by the Commission and any post-effective amendment to the Form AC or the Holding Company Application to be approved by the OTS and will immediately upon receipt of any information concerning the events listed below notify the Agent:
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Bank will endeavor to cause any post-effective amendment to the Registration Statement to be declared effective by the Commission and any post-effective amendment to the Form AC or the Holding Company Application to be approved by the OTS and will, upon receiving information concerning potentially relevant events, notify the Agent as they deem necessary:
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'best efforts' with 'endeavor' and making the notification dependent on what 'they deem necessary' introduces ambiguity and weakens the obligation to proactively pursue regulatory approvals and inform the Agent of potentially relevant events. This contradicts SEC regulations requiring timely and complete disclosure of material information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations regarding timely and complete disclosure of material information.

perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Bank will furnish to the Agent, from time to time during the period when the Prospectus (or any later prospectus related to this offering) is required to be delivered under the 1933 Act or the 1934 Act, such number of copies of such Prospectus (as amended or supplemented) as the Agent may reasonably request for the purposes contemplated by the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, the 1934 Act or the rules and regulations promulgated under the 1934 Act (the "1934 Act Regulations"). The Company authorizes the Agent to use the Prospectus (as amended or supplemented, if amended or supplemented) in any lawful manner contemplated by the Plan in connection with the sale of the Shares by the Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Bank will provide the Agent with some copies of the Prospectus (as amended or supplemented) as they find practical during the period when the Prospectus is to be delivered under securities laws. The Company allows the Agent to use the Prospectus in a manner they consider suitable in connection with the sale of Shares.
perturbation.explanation: This modification makes the provision of the prospectus vague by changing 'such number of copies as the Agent may reasonably request' to 'some copies as they find practical.' Also, changing 'any lawful manner contemplated by the Plan' to 'a manner they consider suitable' makes the permitted use of the prospectus subjective and undefined. This conflicts with requirements under the Securities Act of 1933 regarding the accurate and timely delivery of the prospectus to potential investors.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933 requirements regarding prospectus delivery.

perturbation.original_text: The Bank will maintain appropriate arrangements for depositing all funds received from persons mailing or delivering subscriptions for or orders to purchase Shares in the Offering with the Bank or another financial institution whose deposits are insured by the FDIC, on an interest- bearing basis at the rate described in the Prospectus until the Closing Date and satisfaction of all conditions precedent to the release of the Company's or the Bank's obligation to refund payments received from persons subscribing for or ordering Shares in the Offering in accordance with the Plan and as described in the Prospectus or until refunds of such funds have been made to the persons entitled thereto or withdrawal authorizations canceled in accordance with the Plan and as described in the Prospectus. The Bank will maintain such records of all funds received to permit the funds of each subscriber to be separately insured by the FDIC (to the maximum extent allowable) and to enable the Bank to make the appropriate refunds of such funds in the event that such refunds are required to be made in accordance with the Plan and as described in the Prospectus.
perturbation.changed_text: The Bank will attempt to make some arrangements for depositing funds received from subscriptions for Shares on an interest-bearing basis. The Bank will also attempt to maintain records of funds received.
perturbation.explanation: This weakens the obligation by replacing 'maintain appropriate arrangements' with 'attempt to make some arrangements' and 'will maintain such records' with 'will also attempt to maintain records'. The clear requirement to deposit funds on an interest-bearing basis and keep records to permit separate FDIC insurance coverage is now discretionary, conflicting with FDIC regulations requiring banks to manage and protect depositor funds responsibly.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FDIC regulations regarding the management and protection of depositor funds.
